abstract: Calisto Tanzi, the founder of Parmalat, the Italian dairy company, was convicted Thursday of market rigging and other charges in the 2003 collapse of the company and sentenced to 10 years in prison. Seven other people, including three former Bank of America employees, were acquitted.
lead_paragraph: Calisto Tanzi, the founder of Parmalat, the Italian dairy company, was convicted Thursday of market rigging and other charges in the 2003 collapse of the company and sentenced to 10 years in prison. Seven other people, including three former Bank of America employees, were acquitted.
